I think this is an intended behavior. If you want a detached copy of the data of t1 into t2, you can do as follows

import torch
t1 = torch.tensor([1,1,1], dtype=torch.float, requires_grad=True)
t2 = torch.tensor(t1.data, requires_grad=False)

>>> t1
tensor([1., 1., 1.], requires_grad=True)
>>> t2
tensor([1., 1., 1.])
>>> t2.requires_grad
False

body:
I think this is an intended behavior. If you want a detached copy of the data of `t1` into `t2`, you can do as follows

```python 
import torch
t1 = torch.tensor([1,1,1], dtype=torch.float, requires_grad=True)
t2 = torch.tensor(t1.data, requires_grad=False)

>>> t1
tensor([1., 1., 1.], requires_grad=True)
>>> t2
tensor([1., 1., 1.])
>>> t2.requires_grad
False
